divs: sighting detailsi was preparing to go to bed after watching tv. it was a clear night and i looked out of my window up to the sky as is my habit. it was a clear night and i live in a rural area so there is little light pollution. i saw a star-like object moving across the sky in a south-easterly direction. its trajectory was a flattish curve. i estimate its altitude to be about 20,000 feet but i could not say how big it was. it shone blue\brilliant white. it was certainly not a satellite as it was far too low and it was not a meteor as it did not have a tail, nor did it "flash" as a meteor does in the atmosphere. it was not a jet. the object was silent and appeared to be moving fast. i went outside and watched it as it went away from me towards the low moon and was soon lost against the background of it. i can best describe it thus: it was as if the planet venus, as we see it from earth, had detatched itself from the heavens and flown off into the void. hope this is useful to you. best wishes, mark
trends: There has been one other sighting in York
There were no other sightings in York on or around July 26th 2008
